alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 04 at 4:51PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Lassen County through 515 PM PDT... At 450 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles northeast of Standish, or 21 miles southeast of Termo. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, penny size hail, and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rush Creek Mountain and portions of US-395. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
